DataElement.preferredName: Past Week Breast Carcinoma Affect Ability To Do Regular Daily Activities Other Than Work At Job 11 Point Scale
DataElement.preferredDefinition: A persons' stated observation of how much their breast carcinoma affected their ability to do regular daily activities, other than work at a job, in the past seven days, using an 11 point scale.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Past Week Breast Carcinoma Affected Ability To Do Regular Activity of Daily Living Other Than Work At Occupation
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day._A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla._To be influenced by or changed._The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment._Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement._Perform or execute._Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern._Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living._Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered._Exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something._Used to indicate position, location, or state._The principal activity that a person does to earn money.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most recent week. May include the present day.:A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

Concepts.definition: The most recent week. May include the present day.

A carcinoma arising from the breast, most commonly the terminal ductal-lobular unit. It is the most common malignant tumor in females. Risk factors include country of birth, family history, menstrual and reproductive history, fibrocystic disease and epithelial hyperplasia, exogenous estrogens, contraceptive agents, and ionizing radiation. The vast majority of breast carcinomas are adenocarcinomas (ductal or lobular). Breast carcinoma spreads by direct invasion, by the lymphatic route, and by the blood vessel route. The most common site of lymph node involvement is the axilla.

Property.preferredName: Affected Ability To Do Regular Activity of Daily Living Other Than Work At Occupation
Property.preferredDefinition: To be influenced by or changed.:The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.:Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.:Perform or execute.:Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.:Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living.:Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered.:Exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something.:Used to indicate position, location, or state.:The principal activity that a person does to earn money.

Concepts.definition: To be influenced by or changed.
The quality of being able to perform; a quality that permits or facilitates achievement or accomplishment.
Used as a function word to indicate direction, purpose, or movement.
Perform or execute.
Customary, usual, or at fixed intervals; conforming to a standard or pattern.

Those physical activities which are required for our daily existence. These include personal maintenance activities and activities for maintenance of our living space, as well as activities related to independent living.
Distinct from those already mentioned, listed, or considered.
Exertion or effort directed to produce or accomplish something.
Used to indicate position, location, or state.
The principal activity that a person does to earn money.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Process and results associated with self-reported measures and instruments, surveys, other tools

ValueDomain.preferredName: Breast Cancer Effect On Daily Activities 11 Point Scale
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: An ordered reference standard used with values ranging from 0: Breast cancer had no effect on my daily activities to10: Breast cancer completely prevented me from doing my daily activities.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.: Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

Concepts.definition: To possess every necessary or normal part or component or step; having come or been brought to a conclusion.
Restricted or in amount, size, or extent.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A natural number greater than 8 and less than 10 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

Concepts.definition: A natural number greater than 8 and less than 10 and the quantity that it denotes: the sum of nine and one.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Not my normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activities

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Not my normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activities
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual is not their normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activity.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual is not their normal self, but able to be up and about with fairly normal activity.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A response indicating that an individual's activity is normal with no limitations.

Concepts.definition: A response indicating that an individual's activity is normal with no limitations.

Concepts.definition: An ordered reference standard used to measure incremental changes.
